column4: hey, I was wondering how I can change my desktop to 32bpp(that right?)
it's easiest to just hand edit your /etx/X11/XF86Config file. It is set Default Depth from 16 to 24
how safe is it to edit?
32 bits is really only 24 bits plus and alpha channel
open a gnome-terminal session and type sudo -s (will get you admin piviliges) enter your user password
ok now what? oh ok Treenaks :)
It is for masking graphics afaik
arrow down till you see the Video/Monitor section and look for the setting for DefaultDepth
change the 16 to 24 then hit <crtl> x , then hit enter
if your gaming 16 bit will be MUCH faster
32 bit in Windows is only 24 bit + alpha channel same as Linux
I have the same graphics card (which sucks :D)
